Los Angeles, CA Metro > Los Angeles > Restaurants > Native Foods Restaurant Native Foods Restaurant (310) 209-1055 1110 1/2 Gayley Ave , Los Angeles , CA | Directions 90024 34.060001 -118.446101 View Website
Hours Monday To Sunday From 11:00 AM To 10:00 PM Menu Share Save Own this Business? Recommend this business? Thumbs Up Thumbs Down ? 92 % 100 32 25 Votes Add a Photo Neighborhoods: Westwood, West LA Price: $ Categories: Restaurants Cuisine: Vegetarian , Vegan View More Payment Methods: MasterCard, Discover, Visa, American Express Restaurant Special Features: Local Favorite , Lunch Spot General Info: Open 7 Days View Less At a Glance ? 66% ambiance “The service is great, the people are so friendly, and the atmosphere is very fun.” 100% dessert “hear their desserts are good too.” 88% food quality “The use ABSOLUTELY NO animal products in any of their food, but their food is not dry and tasteless, the way some might expect.” 100% menu variety “The menu features a wide variety of stuff, like salads and creative"bowls"packed with healthy veggies and, often, creatively flavorful meat substitutes (soy, tempeh, etc.)--for those who can't cook like this at home, or miss the taste of real meat.” 100% overall “However I think that if I had never eaten there before, if it didn't used to be my favorite vegan restaurant in LA I would like it a lot.” 60% service “The service is excellent with friendly, suggestion-giving staff.” 100% value “Great food, but prices are a bit on the high side.” 50% wait time “First the service was slow, they made a mistake with my meal and when I brought it to their attention, they denied it, as opposed to fixing it.” Site Feedback Overview Tips (32) Photos (0) Write a Tip for Native Foods Restaurant Sign in to Write a Tip Write a Tip... optional
Tips for Native Foods Restaurant Recommends PhotoJake Joined 1 years ago 5.0 March 09, 2011 5 stars...and I am not even Vegan!. Okay, my girlfriend is but this place is amazing! I defy you to find a healthier, better tasting meal for the prices there, seriously. 0 Heart Recommends DianaTakesaBite Joined 6 years ago 4.0 January 17, 2010 Chicken what? Chicken who?. Chickens needn't run for cover in the vicinity of Native Foods, a quick-service vegan restaurant that can turn even a carnivore's head. While the Westwood eatery is famous among UCLA students for its sweet potato fries, the Ensalada Azteca with fresh avocado, cucumber and jicama salsa, quinoa, romaine, currants, toasted pumpkin seeds, cilantro, and mango lime vinaigrette ($9.95), is what keeps me coming back. With the addition of blackened tempeh, this hearty salad could easily go head to head with a medium rare rib-eye. Or, at the very least, convince a meat-lovin' gal to give her steak knife a break. … View More View Less 0 Heart Recommends KRamos Joined 3 years ago 4.0 July 09, 2009 REVIEW FROM CITYSEARCH's 3BUCKBITES DICTATOR. Being vegan doesn't always mean tofu and celery sticks - at least not with Native Foods'sweet potato fries. This vegan-food-only restaurant is bound to cheer you up whether you're a plant eater or not, with pictures of friendly animals on the napkin dispensers and signs asking you to kindly leave your milk products at home. The sweet potato fries are a new creation and not yet on the menu, and while less sweet than others I've had, they are made from fresh sweet potatoes and are crispy and delicious: the perfect snack to make you feel better about the world. … View More View Less 0 Heart Recommends dthstar Joined 4 years ago 4.0 April 17, 2008 flavorful vegan. along w/ RAW and RFD, this place is definitely up there in terms of serving up the most tasty'vegan'organic healthy cuisine. it's fairly small and the decor is nothing to talk about&there's no parking (as it IS in westwood)&they don't deliver, but for me to put up w/ all the above suggests that the food might be the only thing that actually makes up for all that it lacks, and it does. even my friends who don't like 'vegan' or healthy food have all raved about this place, so that says a lot. … View More View Less 0 Heart Recommends abd1350 Joined 4 years ago 5.0 January 23, 2008 LOVE this place.. Being a vegetarian, I am always on the lookout for good places to eat, and this one is definitely my top so far. I have never had a bad meal here...and for the carnivores, the fake chicken actually tastes like chicken (no joke), maybe even better. I love their bowls. The service is great, the people are so friendly, and the atmosphere is very fun. If you haven't tried Native Foods yet, go! … View More View Less 0 Heart See more tips for Native Foods Restaurant Write a Tip for Native Foods Restaurant Sign in to Write a Tip Write a Tip... optional
